Anniversary](https://www.un.org/en/un80) [![Image 2: Two kids walk together on a dirt road. In the background, soldiers are lined up near a military vehicle. ](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/3x2-front-thumbnail/public/2025/05/id-innocent-children-victims-of-aggression-2025.jpg)](https://www.un.org/en/observances/child-victim-day) [Children](https://www.un.org/en/property-cards-by-og-global-category/287/9421) [Children under attack](https://www.un.org/en/observances/child-victim-day) --------------------------------------------------------------------------- Children living in conflict zones around the world face unspeakable horrors. Unable to sleep at home or play outside, these children cannot attend school or receive medical care in hospitals. Caught up in wars involving killing, maiming, abduction, and sexual violence, they are denied the humanitarian assistance desperately needed. On the [International Day of Innocent Children Victims of Aggression](https://www.un.org/en/observances/child-victim-day) (4 June), the UN stresses that the most effective way to protect children from hostilities is to eliminate the push and pull factors leading to their involvement in armed conflict. According to the UN Secretary-General Annual Report on Children and Armed Conflict 11,649 children were killed or maimed in 2023 alone. Photo:UN/Eric Kanalstein. [![Image 3: Palestinians in Gaza continue lack access to basic humanitarian needs.](https://global.unitednations.entermediadb.net/assets/mediadb/services/module/asset/downloads/preset/Libraries/Production%20Library/04-06-2025-gaza2.jpg/image560x340cropped.jpg)](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/06/1164011) ### [Gaza: UN relief chief welcomes growing support for aid teams to resume vital work](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/06/1164011) 4 June 2025 — Amid reports of yet another deadly attack on a school in Gaza on Wednesday, the UN’s top aid official Tom Fletcher welcomed growing international calls for lifesaving aid work by... [![Image 4: Chad. Rapid Influx of Sudanese refugees leaves thousands in desperate need](https://global.unitednations.entermediadb.net/assets/mediadb/services/module/asset/downloads/preset/Collections/Embargoed/06-05-2025-UNHCR-Sudan-Chad-04.jpg/image560x340cropped.jpg)](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/06/1163976) ### [Sudan: Rise in people fleeing to Chad as violence surges](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/06/1163976) 3 June 2025 — The number of Sudanese refugees in Chad has more than tripled in just over two years amid the ongoing war in their homeland, the UN refugee agency UNHCR said in an alert on Tuesday... [![Image 5: Five-year-old Ayman Abu Hujair receives treatment after an airstrike at Gaza's Al-Hasayneh School (file, May 2025)](https://global.unitednations.entermediadb.net/assets/mediadb/services/module/asset/downloads/preset/Collections/Embargoed/30-05-2025-UNICEF-Gaza-09.jpg/image560x340cropped.jpg)](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/06/1163966) ### [Gaza: UN rights chief condemns new killings around private aid hub](https://news.un.org/en/story/2025/06/1163966) 3 June 2025 — UN human rights chief Volker Türk has condemned new reports that dozens more Gazans were killed early Tuesday “trying to access paltry amounts of food” around a private aid hub in... [UN Sustainable Development Goals](https://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ ### 17 Goals to transform our world The [Sustainable Development Goals](https://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/) are a call for action by all countries — poor, rich and middle-income — to promote prosperity while protecting the planet. [![Image 6: hands holding megaphone and speech bubble](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/3x2-front-thumbnail/public/2024/04/actnow.png)](https://www.un.org/en/actnow/) #### [ActNow Campaign](https://www.un.org/en/actnow/) [ActNow](https://www.un.org/en/actnow/) is the UN campaign to inspire people to act for the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). In the lead up to the [Summit of the Future](https://www.un.org/en/summit-of-the-future), join the **1 Million Actions for our Common Future challenge** to contribute to a more sustainable and peaceful world. Find new inspiring actions on[the app](https://actnow.aworld.org/)and at [un.org/actnow](http://www.un.org/en/actnow/). [![Image 7: Thomas the Tank engine](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/3x2-front-thumbnail/public/2019/10/thomas.jpg)](https://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/student-resources/) #### [Student Resources on the SDGs](https://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/student-resources/) Learn more about the Sustainable Development Goals! On our[student resources page](https://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/student-resources/ "https://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/student-resources/")you will find plenty of materials for young people and adults alike. Share with your family and friends to help achieve a better world for all. [![Image 8: Save the date image for 2025 UN Ocean conference.](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/3x2-front-thumbnail/public/sdg_mz_web.png)](https://www.un.org/en/sdgmediazone) #### [SDG Media Zone](https://www.un.org/en/sdgmediazone) Be part of the global conversation on ocean action and sustainable development at the [UN Ocean Conference](https://sdgs.un.org/conferences/ocean2025). From ocean science and biodiversity to pollution, maritime transport, and sustainable fishing, this pivotal event will spotlight the urgent solutions needed to achieve the [SDGs](https://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/). Don’t miss the [SDG Media Zone](https://www.un.org/en/sdgmediazone), where global changemakers bring key issues to life through powerful interviews and thought-provoking discussions. [Full programme](https://www.un.org/en/sdgmediazone/oceans/programme) [![Image 9: icon with fish swimming below waves](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/3x2-front-thumbnail/public/2025/06/sdg-goal-14.png)](https://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/goal-of-the-month/) #### [Goal of the month](https://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/goal-of-the-month/) ##### [Goal 14: Conserve and sustainably use the oceans, seas and marine resources](https://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/oceans/) Healthy oceans and seas are essential to human existence and life on Earth. [More about the UN Sustainable Development Goals](https://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/) More from the United Nations ------------------------------ Featured stories from across the United Nations and our world-wide family of agencies, funds, and programmes. [![Image 10: A collage featuring various elements: an old television with an eye displayed on the screen and an antenna on top, three faces with open mouths and curved white ribbons with random alphanumeric characters.](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/3x2-front-thumbnail/public/2025/05/290525-undp-disinformation.jpg)](https://climatepromise.undp.org/news-and-stories/what-are-climate-misinformation-and-disinformation-and-how-can-we-tackle-them)[Disinformation](https://www.un.org/en/property-cards-by-og-global-category/287/16492), [Climate Change](https://www.un.org/en/property-cards-by-og-global-category/287/9424) #### [How can we tackle climate misinformation and disinformation?](https://climatepromise.undp.org/news-and-stories/what-are-climate-misinformation-and-disinformation-and-how-can-we-tackle-them) The fight against climate misinformation is a global effort involving governments, academia, media, and civil society. These actors engage in research, policy advocacy, education, and public outreach to combat misinformation that undermines climate understanding and action. The UN has launched [the Global Principles for Information Integrity](https://www.un.org/en/information-integrity) to promote healthy information spaces, and in November 2024, a [Global Initiative for Information Integrity on Climate Change](https://www.un.org/en/climatechange/information-integrity) was established by Brazil, the UN, and UNESCO. However, most efforts are concentrated in the Global North, highlighting the need to empower Global South stakeholders to address climate misinformation. [![Image 11: Back of a person's head with braided hair and background featuring a futuristic cityscape with tall, reflective buildings that have circuit-like patterns on their surfaces.](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/3x2-front-thumbnail/public/2025/05/290525-ohchr-2025-05-16-hero-story-main.jpg)](https://www.ohchr.org/en/stories/2025/05/reparatory-justice-age-artificial-intelligence)[África](https://www.un.org/en/property-cards-by-og-global-category/287/13680), [OHCHR](https://www.un.org/en/property-cards-by-og-global-category/287/9064) #### [Reparatory justice in the age of Artificial Intelligence](https://www.ohchr.org/en/stories/2025/05/reparatory-justice-age-artificial-intelligence) With calls for reparations for the historical legacies of enslavement and colonialism growing louder, this year's [Permanent Forum on People of African Descent](https://www.ohchr.org/en/permanent-forum-people-african-descent) held a session titled "Africa and People of African Descent: United for reparatory justice in the age of artificial intelligence”. Participants emphasised that the injustices of colonialism and systemic racism continue to affect African nations and people of African descent. They highlighted that reparative justice should include formal apologies, truth-telling processes and various forms of reparations, in order to foster reconciliation, justice, equality and solidarity in society. [![Image 12: A Brazilian woman holding a bunch of vegetables in an orchard.](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/3x2-front-thumbnail/public/2025/05/290525-fao-la-biodiversity-1.jpg)](https://www.fao.org/newsroom/story/three-tales-of-biodiversity-revival-in-latin-america/en)[Agriculture and Food](https://www.un.org/en/property-cards-by-og-global-category/287/6611), [FAO](https://www.un.org/en/property-cards-by-og-global-category/287/13899) #### [Three tales of biodiversity revival in Latin America](https://www.fao.org/newsroom/story/three-tales-of-biodiversity-revival-in-latin-america/en) From the highest cloud forest in the Andes to one of the smallest fish in a Chilean river, biodiversity is the invisible thread that ties ecosystems together and sustains agricultural production and food security. Biodiversity is crucial for ecosystems and agricultural production, especially in Latin America and the Caribbean, which host about 50% of the world’s primary forests. These forests play vital roles in carbon sequestration. However, biodiversity is declining due to human activities and climate change. The agrifood sector depends on biodiversity for services like soil health, pest control, and pollination. Acknowledging this, three [GEF](https://www.fao.org/gef/en)-funded [FAO](https://www.fao.org/home/en/) projects are dedicated to conserving and restoring ecosystems in Brazil, Chile, and Venezuela. [![Image 13: A military woman placing a medal on her male colleague. ](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/3x2-front-thumbnail/public/2025/05/unwomen_women_peace.jpg)](https://www.unwomen.org/en/news-stories/feature-story/2025/05/who-are-the-women-leading-peacekeeping) [Women and Gender Equality](https://www.un.org/en/property-cards-by-og-global-category/287/6658), [UN Women](https://www.un.org/en/property-cards-by-og-global-category/287/6929) #### [Women for peace](https://www.unwomen.org/en/news-stories/feature-story/2025/05/who-are-the-women-leading-peacekeeping) Thirty years after the Beijing Platform for Action, women remain underrepresented in UN peace operations, yet their leadership is crucial to building lasting global peace and security. [![Image 14: A lady working on wood. ](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/3x2-front-thumbnail/public/2025/05/unesco_art.png)](https://www.unesco.org/en/articles/training-hub-boost-creative-careers-and-heritage-caribbean) [Art](https://www.un.org/en/property-cards-by-og-global-category/287/11310), [Culture](https://www.un.org/en/property-cards-by-og-global-category/287/11307), [UNESCO](https://www.un.org/en/property-cards-by-og-global-category/287/13920) #### [Restoring cultural heritage](https://www.unesco.org/en/articles/training-hub-boost-creative-careers-and-heritage-caribbean) Deborah Papannah, a 27-year-old visual arts student, is pursuing a career in restoration to preserve her country's colonial buildings and artifacts, empowered by training from [UNESCO’s Transcultura](https://www.unesco.org/en/transcultura?hub=66907) programme. [![Image 15: A mother feeding her child a special peanut paste from a sachet.](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/3x2-front-thumbnail/public/2025/05/wfp_hunger.jpeg)](https://www.wfp.org/stories/wfp-and-unicef-fight-child-wasting-where-it-hits-hardest) [SDG 2: Zero Hunger](https://www.un.org/en/property-cards-by-og-global-category/287/6533), [WFP](https://www.un.org/en/property-cards-by-og-global-category/287/6926) #### [Battling child malnutrition](https://www.wfp.org/stories/wfp-and-unicef-fight-child-wasting-where-it-hits-hardest) The darkest moments for Nyanene Gatdoor come when her 2-year-old son Tuach sobs from hunger. “When the baby is crying in front of you, and you have nothing to give him, you feel pain in your heart,” says the 25-year-old mother of 3. [![Image 16: A man carrying his daughter on a baby carrier fashioned with a seat. ](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/3x2-front-thumbnail/public/2025/05/wipo_tushbaby.jpg)](https://www.wipo.int/en/web/ip-advantage/w/stories/tushbaby-revolutionizing-baby-carrying-for-modern-parents) [SDG 9: Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure](https://www.un.org/en/property-cards-by-og-global-category/287/7003), [WIPO](https://www.un.org/en/property-cards-by-og-global-category/287/6964) #### [Carrying a global vision](https://www.wipo.int/en/web/ip-advantage/w/stories/tushbaby-revolutionizing-baby-carrying-for-modern-parents) From a mother’s struggle to an international brand, Tammy Rant, founder of Tushbaby revolutionized babywearing through thoughtful design, global trademark protection, and a commitment to supporting parents everywhere. [More from the United Nations](https://www.un.org/en/#) What we do ---------- Due to the powers vested in its Charter and its unique international character, the United Nations can take action on the issues confronting humanity in the 21st century, including: * [Maintain international peace and security](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/maintain-international-peace-and-security) * [Protect human rights](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/protect-human-rights) * [Deliver humanitarian aid](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/deliver-humanitarian-aid) * [Promote sustainable development](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/support-sustainable-development-and-climate-action) * [Uphold international law](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/uphold-international-law) [![Image 17: A child has a meal at a food distribution centre in the Rwanda camp for internally displaced persons (IDPs), near Tawila, North Darfur. More than 8,000 women and children living in the camp benefit from nutrition programmes run by the World Food Programme](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/large-article-image-style-16-9/public/2021/09/A%20child%20has%20a%20meal%20at%20a%20food%20distribution%20centre%20in%20the%20Rwanda%20camp%20for%20internally%20displaced%20persons)](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/deliver-humanitarian-aid) #### Deliver Humanitarian Aid One of the purposes of the United Nations, as stated in its [Charter](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/un-charter), is "to achieve international co-operation in solving international problems of an economic, social, cultural, or humanitarian character." The UN first did this in the aftermath of the Second World War on the devastated continent of Europe, which it helped to rebuild. The Organization is now relied upon by the international community to coordinate [humanitarian relief](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/deliver-humanitarian-aid) operations due to natural and man-made disasters in areas beyond the relief capacity of national authorities alone. [![Image 18: Grace, a farmer from Kipilat village, and a leading member of the forest community in Ainabkoi, Kenya, planting a tree in 2012.](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/large-article-image-style-16-9/public/2019/08/community%20leader%20from%20Kenya%20planting%20trees)](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/support-sustainable-development-and-climate-action) #### Promote Sustainable Development From the start in 1945, one of the main priorities of the United Nations was to “achieve international co-operation in solving international problems of an economic, social, cultural, or humanitarian character and in promoting and encouraging respect for human rights and for fundamental freedoms for all without distinction as to race, sex, language, or religion.” Improving people’s well-being continues to be one of the main focuses of the UN. The global understanding of development has changed over the years, and countries now have agreed that [sustainable development](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/support-sustainable-development-and-climate-action) offers the best path forward for improving the lives of people everywhere. [![Image 19: The International Court of Justice (ICJ) delivers its order on the request for the indication of provisional measures filed by Nicaragua on 11 October 2013 in the case concerning Construction of a Road in Costa Rica along the San Juan River.](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/large-article-image-style-16-9/public/2019/08/great%20hall%20justice%20peace%20palace)](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/uphold-international-law) #### Uphold International Law The [UN Charter](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/un-charter), in its[Preamble](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/un-charter/preamble), set an objective: "to establish conditions under which justice and respect for the obligations arising from treaties and other sources of [international law](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/uphold-international-law) can be maintained."Ever since, the development of, and respect for international law has been a key part of the work of the Organization. This work is carried out in many ways - by courts, tribunals, multilateral treaties - and by the Security Council, which can approve peacekeeping missions, impose sanctions, or authorize the use of force when there is a threat to international peace and security, if it deems this necessary. These powers are given to it by the UN Charter, which is considered an international treaty. As such, it is an instrument of international law, and UN Member States are bound by it. The UN Charter codifies the major principles of international relations, from sovereign equality of States to the prohibition of the use of force in international relations. [![Image 20: A UNIFIL peacekeeper from Spain on a regular patrol in the vicinity of Al Wazzani, south-eastern Lebanon as the sun sets in the horizon. Since 1948, more than a million women and men have served as UN peacekeepers.](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/large-article-image-style-16-9/public/2021/07/UNIFIL%20peacekeeper%20from%20Spain)](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/maintain-international-peace-and-security) #### Maintain International Peace and Security The United Nations came into being in 1945, following the devastation of the Second World War, with one central mission:the [maintenance of international peace and security](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/maintain-international-peace-and-security). The UN does this by working to prevent conflict; helping parties in conflict make peace; peacekeeping; and creating the conditions to allow peace to hold and flourish.These activities often overlap and should reinforce one another, to be effective. The UN Security Council has the primary responsibility for international peace and security. The General Assembly and the Secretary-General play major, important, and complementary roles, along with other UN offices and bodies. [![Image 21: Students at Butkhak High School in Kabul, Afghanistan, cheer in unison on the last day of Global Action Week, an international campaign advocating free, quality education for all.](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/large-article-image-style-16-9/public/2019/08/afghan-students-cheering.jpg)](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/protect-human-rights) #### Protect Human Rights The term “[human rights](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/protect-human-rights)” was mentioned seven times in the UN's founding [Charter](http://www.un.org/en/documents/charter/), making the promotion and protection of human rights a key purpose and guiding principle of the Organization. In 1948, the [Universal Declaration of Human Rights](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/universal-declaration-of-human-rights) brought human rights into the realm of international law. Since then, the Organization has diligently protected human rights through legal instruments and on-the-ground activities. [![Image 22: A child has a meal at a food distribution centre in the Rwanda camp for internally displaced persons (IDPs), near Tawila, North Darfur. More than 8,000 women and children living in the camp benefit from nutrition programmes run by the World Food Programme](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/large-article-image-style-16-9/public/2021/09/A%20child%20has%20a%20meal%20at%20a%20food%20distribution%20centre%20in%20the%20Rwanda%20camp%20for%20internally%20displaced%20persons)](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/deliver-humanitarian-aid) #### Deliver Humanitarian Aid One of the purposes of the United Nations, as stated in its [Charter](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/un-charter), is "to achieve international co-operation in solving international problems of an economic, social, cultural, or humanitarian character." The UN first did this in the aftermath of the Second World War on the devastated continent of Europe, which it helped to rebuild. The Organization is now relied upon by the international community to coordinate [humanitarian relief](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/deliver-humanitarian-aid) operations due to natural and man-made disasters in areas beyond the relief capacity of national authorities alone. [![Image 23: Grace, a farmer from Kipilat village, and a leading member of the forest community in Ainabkoi, Kenya, planting a tree in 2012.](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/large-article-image-style-16-9/public/2019/08/community%20leader%20from%20Kenya%20planting%20trees)](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/support-sustainable-development-and-climate-action) #### Promote Sustainable Development From the start in 1945, one of the main priorities of the United Nations was to “achieve international co-operation in solving international problems of an economic, social, cultural, or humanitarian character and in promoting and encouraging respect for human rights and for fundamental freedoms for all without distinction as to race, sex, language, or religion.” Improving people’s well-being continues to be one of the main focuses of the UN. The global understanding of development has changed over the years, and countries now have agreed that [sustainable development](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/support-sustainable-development-and-climate-action) offers the best path forward for improving the lives of people everywhere. [![Image 24: The International Court of Justice (ICJ) delivers its order on the request for the indication of provisional measures filed by Nicaragua on 11 October 2013 in the case concerning Construction of a Road in Costa Rica along the San Juan River.](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/large-article-image-style-16-9/public/2019/08/great%20hall%20justice%20peace%20palace)](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/uphold-international-law) #### Uphold International Law The [UN Charter](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/un-charter), in its[Preamble](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/un-charter/preamble), set an objective: "to establish conditions under which justice and respect for the obligations arising from treaties and other sources of [international law](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/uphold-international-law) can be maintained."Ever since, the development of, and respect for international law has been a key part of the work of the Organization. This work is carried out in many ways - by courts, tribunals, multilateral treaties - and by the Security Council, which can approve peacekeeping missions, impose sanctions, or authorize the use of force when there is a threat to international peace and security, if it deems this necessary. These powers are given to it by the UN Charter, which is considered an international treaty. As such, it is an instrument of international law, and UN Member States are bound by it. The UN Charter codifies the major principles of international relations, from sovereign equality of States to the prohibition of the use of force in international relations. [![Image 25: A UNIFIL peacekeeper from Spain on a regular patrol in the vicinity of Al Wazzani, south-eastern Lebanon as the sun sets in the horizon. Since 1948, more than a million women and men have served as UN peacekeepers.](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/large-article-image-style-16-9/public/2021/07/UNIFIL%20peacekeeper%20from%20Spain)](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/maintain-international-peace-and-security) #### Maintain International Peace and Security The United Nations came into being in 1945, following the devastation of the Second World War, with one central mission:the [maintenance of international peace and security](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/maintain-international-peace-and-security). The UN does this by working to prevent conflict; helping parties in conflict make peace; peacekeeping; and creating the conditions to allow peace to hold and flourish.These activities often overlap and should reinforce one another, to be effective. The UN Security Council has the primary responsibility for international peace and security. The General Assembly and the Secretary-General play major, important, and complementary roles, along with other UN offices and bodies. [![Image 26: Students at Butkhak High School in Kabul, Afghanistan, cheer in unison on the last day of Global Action Week, an international campaign advocating free, quality education for all.](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/large-article-image-style-16-9/public/2019/08/afghan-students-cheering.jpg)](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/protect-human-rights) #### Protect Human Rights The term “[human rights](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/protect-human-rights)” was mentioned seven times in the UN's founding [Charter](http://www.un.org/en/documents/charter/), making the promotion and protection of human rights a key purpose and guiding principle of the Organization. In 1948, the [Universal Declaration of Human Rights](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/universal-declaration-of-human-rights) brought human rights into the realm of international law. Since then, the Organization has diligently protected human rights through legal instruments and on-the-ground activities. [![Image 27: A child has a meal at a food distribution centre in the Rwanda camp for internally displaced persons (IDPs), near Tawila, North Darfur. More than 8,000 women and children living in the camp benefit from nutrition programmes run by the World Food Programme](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/large-article-image-style-16-9/public/2021/09/A%20child%20has%20a%20meal%20at%20a%20food%20distribution%20centre%20in%20the%20Rwanda%20camp%20for%20internally%20displaced%20persons)](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/deliver-humanitarian-aid) #### Deliver Humanitarian Aid One of the purposes of the United Nations, as stated in its [Charter](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/un-charter), is "to achieve international co-operation in solving international problems of an economic, social, cultural, or humanitarian character." The UN first did this in the aftermath of the Second World War on the devastated continent of Europe, which it helped to rebuild. The Organization is now relied upon by the international community to coordinate [humanitarian relief](https://www.un.org/en/our-work/deliver-humanitarian-aid) operations due to natural and man-made disasters in areas beyond the relief capacity of national authorities alone. prev next Structure of the United Nations --------------------------------- The main parts of the UN structure are the [General Assembly](http://www.un.org/en/ga/), the [Security Council](https://www.un.org/securitycouncil/),the [Economic and Social Council](http://www.un.org/en/ecosoc/), the [Trusteeship Council](https://www.un.org/en/sections/about-un/trusteeship-council/), the [International Court of Justice](http://www.icj-cij.org/en), and the [UN Secretariat](https://www.un.org/en/sections/about-un/secretariat/). All were established in 1945 when the UN was founded. #### [General Assembly](https://www.un.org/en/ga/) The General Assembly is the main deliberative,policymaking and representative organ of the UN. All 193 Member States of the UN are represented in the General Assembly, making it the only UN body with universal representation. #### [Security Council](https://www.un.org/securitycouncil/) The Security Council has primary responsibility, under the UN Charter, for the maintenance of international peace and security. It has 15 Members (5 permanent and 10 non-permanent members). Each Member has one vote. Under the Charter, all Member States are obligated to comply with Council decisions. #### [Economic and Social Council](http://www.un.org/en/ecosoc/) The Economic and Social Council is the principal body for coordination, policy review, policy dialogue and recommendations on economic, social and environmental issues, as well as implementation of internationally agreed development goals. #### [Trusteeship Council](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/trusteeship-council) The Trusteeship Council was established in 1945 by the UN Charter, under Chapter XIII, to provide international supervision for 11 Trust Territories that had been placed under the administration of seven Member States, and ensure that adequate steps were taken to prepare the Territories for self-government and independence. #### [International Court of Justice](https://www.icj-cij.org/en) The International Court of Justice is the principal judicial organ of the United Nations. Its seat is at the Peace Palace in the Hague (Netherlands). It is the only one of the six principal organs of the United Nations not located in New York (United States of America). #### [Secretariat](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/secretariat) The Secretariat comprises the Secretary-General and tens of thousands of international UN staff members who carry out the day-to-day work of the UN as mandated by the General Assembly and the Organization's other principal organs. [More about the structure of the United Nations](https://www.un.org/en/about-un/) Learn more ---------- [![Image 28](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/3x2-front-thumbnail/public/2019/07/our-priorities_climate-change.jpg)](https://www.un.org/en/climatechange/) #### [Climate Change](https://www.un.org/en/climatechange/) Climate change is the defining issue of our time and now is the defining moment to do something about it. There is still time to tackle climate change, but it will require an unprecedented effort from all sectors of society. [![Image 29: Women at UN CSW63 Side Event - “Take the Hot Seat”. Photo: UN Women/Ryan Brown](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/3x2-front-thumbnail/public/2019/07/our-priorities_gender-equality.jpg)](https://www.un.org/en/global-issues/gender-equality) #### [Gender Equality](https://www.un.org/en/global-issues/gender-equality) Women and girls represent half of the world’s population and, therefore, also half of its potential. Gender equality, besides being a fundamental human right, is essential to achieve peaceful societies, with full human potential and sustainable development. [![Image 30: UN Secretary-General António Guterres is greeted on his visit to the Central African Republic](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/3x2-front-thumbnail/public/2019/08/our-priorities_ending-poverty.jpg)](https://www.un.org/en/global-issues/ending-poverty) #### [Ending Poverty](https://www.un.org/en/global-issues/ending-poverty) While global poverty rates have been cut by more than half since 2000, one in ten people in developing regions still lives on less than US$1.90 a day — the internationally agreed poverty line, and millions of others live on slightly more than this daily amount. [![Image 31: A young girl holds a smiling infant at the Zaatari Refugee Camp](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/3x2-front-thumbnail/public/2022/09/children-jordan.jpg)](https://www.un.org/en/common-agenda) #### [Our Common Agenda](https://www.un.org/en/common-agenda) Following up on a [pledge](https://undocs.org/en/A/RES/75/1) made by UN Member States at the [UN’s 75 th anniversary](https://www.un.org/en/un75), the report [Our Common Agenda](https://www.un.org/en/content/common-agenda-report/) looks ahead to the next 25 years and represents the Secretary-General’s vision on the [future of global cooperation](https://www.un.org/en/summit-of-the-future). It calls for inclusive, networked, and effective multilateralism to better respond to humanity’s most pressing challenges. [Did you know?](https://www.un.org/en/sections/issues-depth/global-issues-overview/) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ As the world’s only truly universal global organization, the United Nations has become the foremost forum to address [issues](https://www.un.org/en/sections/issues-depth/global-issues-overview/index.html) that transcend national boundaries and cannot be resolved by any one country acting alone. #### [More than two-thirds of the world's children live in countries affected by armed conflict.](https://www.un.org/en/global-issues/children) ![Image 32](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/2020/03/icon-children-4.svg) Find out more in ##### [Global Issues: Children](https://www.un.org/en/global-issues/children) #### [The United States, China and France were the top three nuclear power producers in 2023.](https://www.un.org/en/global-issues/atomic-energy) ![Image 33](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/2020/03/icon-atomic-energy-4.svg) Find out more in ##### [Global Issues: Atomic Energy](https://www.un.org/en/global-issues/atomic-energy) #### [Despite the progress made, AIDS claimed a life every minute in 2023.](https://www.un.org/en/global-issues/aids) ![Image 34](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/2020/03/icon-aids-3.svg) Find out more in ##### [Global Issues: AIDS](https://www.un.org/en/global-issues/aids) #### [122.6 million people were forcibly displaced worldwide at the end of June 2024.](https://www.un.org/en/global-issues/refugees) ![Image 35](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/2020/03/icon-refugees-4.svg) Find out more in ##### [Global Issues: Refugees](https://www.un.org/en/global-issues/refugees) Watch and Listen ---------------- Video and audio from across the United Nations and our world-wide family of agencies,funds, and programmes. #### Raising parents: The joys and challenges of parenthood What does parenting really look like? June is [Parenting Month](https://www.unicef.org/parenting/raising-parents?utm_source=referral&utm_medium=un-en&utm_campaign=parenting_month-2025-en), and [Raising Parents](https://www.unicef.org/parenting/raising-parents) invites you into the lives of four families as they navigate the everyday joys and challenges of parenthood.With support from The LEGO Foundation, this short film is a powerful reminder that just as there is no one way to raise a child, there is also no one way to be a parent. Join us on June 1 2025,[for the premeire](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gJBBMAjPiYc) and let's watch it together. #### World No Tobacco Day 2025 Every day, tobacco and nicotine industries use carefully engineered products and deceptive tactics to hook a new generation of users and keep existing ones.[Unmask the appeal](https://www.who.int/campaigns/world-no-tobacco-day/2025). #### Quality of mortality data Accurate death certificates and coding are essential for quality mortality data and effective public health strategies. ### UN Podcasts ![Image 36: A consumer uses his mobile phone to unlock a scooter sharing rental service in Lima, Peru](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/3x2-front-thumbnail/public/2022/10/mobile-phone-unlock-scooter.jpg) #### Copper: Essential to our transition to clean energy, but at what cost? It’s more than just a metal. It’s in our phones, our homes, our cars – quietly powering our daily lives. As demand increases for clean technologies, like solar panels and electric vehicles, copper is increasingly in the spotlight. But what are the costs and consequences of mining it – and who really benefits? Can we meet these demands without repeating past mistakes? In this episode of [UNCTAD](https://unctad.org/)’s [The Weekly Tradecast](https://unctadonline.podbean.com/e/copper-essential-to-our-move-to-clean-energy-%e2%80%93-but-at-what-cost/), we speak with Professor Daniel Franks, Director of the Global Centre for Mineral Security at the University of Queensland. Listen now to learn about the global race for critical minerals, the environmental and social costs of extraction, and the urgent need for inclusive reforms in how we power our future. Your browser does not support the audio element. [![Image 37](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/aan_660.png)](https://www.un.org/awake-at-night) [Latest Audio from UN News](https://news.un.org/en/audio-hub) [More live and on-demand videos from the UN](http://webtv.un.org/) The United Nations in Pictures ------------------------------ Images from across the United Nations and our world-wide family of agencies, funds, and programmes. [![Image 38: A baby sitting in a rug in central Myanmar, the country was hit recently by two earthquakes.](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/3x2-front-thumbnail/public/2025/05/290525-ocha-myanmar.jpg)](https://unocha.exposure.co/myanmar-under-the-open-sky) Photo:OCHA [**Myanmar, under the open sky**](https://unocha.exposure.co/myanmar-under-the-open-sky) Two powerful earthquakes hit central Myanmar on 28 March 2025, destroying thousands of homes and reducing hospitals, schools and other essential infrastructure to rubble. Weeks later, millions of people are still struggling to adapt to their new reality: living in makeshift shelters that expose them to scorching heatwaves, early rains and alarming protection risks. Here are some of their stories. You can help: Support the Myanmar Humanitarian Fund. [Your donation](https://crisisrelief.un.org/en/myanmar-earthquake) will directly help local organizations. [![Image 39: A jaguar roaring in Comandante Andresito, a town located on the Argentina border between Brazil and Paraguay.](https://www.un.org/sites/un2.un.org/files/styles/3x2-front-thumbnail/public/2025/05/290525-undp-jaguar.jpg)](https://stories.undp.org/where-hope-roars) Photo:UNDP Argentina/Emilio White **[Where hope roars](https://stories.undp.org/where-hope-roars)** Diego, Hilda, Juan, and their son Hugo are farmers in Comandante Andresito, Argentina, where together they face the same challenge, living alongside jaguars, known as 'yaguareté' in the region. These large felines, significant in [indigenous culture](https://www.nationalgeographic.com/history/history-magazine/article/jaguar-natural-history-mesoamerica), have seen their population decline by 50% since the 19th century, largely due to habitat loss and conflict with livestock farmers. In Argentina, the situation is even more dire. It’s estimated that[95 percent](https://www.infobae.com/sociedad/2017/09/24/situacion-critica-del-yaguarete-en-argentina-quedan-menos-de-250-y-salvarlo-parece-una-utopia/)of the jaguar's original habitat has been lost. To alleviate these issues, a [protection](https://www.undp.org/es/argentina/noticias/undp-argentina-and-government-misiones-launch-worlds-first-jaguar-protection-insurance) insurance program was introduced, providing farmers with financial compensation and technical support following confirmed jaguar attacks.
